meanings.definition: To gather into a mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: The children were conglomerating their toys into a big pile.
meanings.sent2: The chef was conglomerating various ingredients to make a delicious soup.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were conglomerating acorns in a comical tower.
meanings.sent4: The artist was conglomerating colors on the canvas, creating a vibrant painting.
meanings.sent5: The students were conglomerating ideas for their group project, brainstorming together.

meanings.definition: To combine into a single entity.
meanings.sent1: The company was conglomerating its subsidiaries to form a larger corporation.
meanings.sent2: She was conglomerating her savings to buy a new car.
meanings.sent3: The birds were conglomerating twigs to build a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: The magician was conglomerating different elements to perform a spectacular trick.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were conglomerating into a complete picture as she solved it.

meanings.definition: To come together and form a group.
meanings.sent1: The students were conglomerating in the cafeteria for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were conglomerating in the square to voice their concerns.
meanings.sent3: The ants were conglomerating in a line, marching towards their anthill.
meanings.sent4: The stars were conglomerating in the night sky, creating a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent5: The team was conglomerating their skills to win the championship.
